unnormalised: Oh man, LaTeX in college! I remember struggling with that during my B.Sc. maths course. Prof. Sharma always said to use it for our assignments, especially when showing complex equations like $\int_{0}^{\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} dx = \frac{\pi}{2}$. I spent hours just trying to get the fractions and subscripts right, and don't even get me started on matrices! One time, I forgot a single backslash, and the whole document wouldn't compile. My friend Rohan helped me out, showing how Overleaf made things slightly easier. Good times, but definitely a steep learning curve.
normalised: Oh man, L-A-T-E-X in college! I remember struggling with that during my B-S-c maths course. Professor Sharma always said to use it for our assignments, especially when showing complex equations like integral from zero to infinity of sine x divided by x d x equals pi divided by two. I spent hours just trying to get the fractions and subscripts right, and do not even get me started on matrices! One time, I forgot a single backslash, and the whole document would not compile. My friend Rohan helped me out, showing how Overleaf made things slightly easier. Good times, but definitely a steep learning curve.
